page.title: 12LOCAL GOVERNMENT IN THURSTON
page.content:
THURSTON PARISH COUNCIL
The Minor Local Authority in Thurston is the Parish Council.This was formed in 1894.Members are elected to the Council by the residents of the village who are over 18, every 4 years. There are 9 Councillors for Thurston. They look after footpaths and street- lighting and administer the Cavendish Meadow Playing Field. They consider planning applications for new buildings,or for alterations to existing buildings,and make their recommendations to the Mid-Suffolk District Council. They nominate two members to sit on the Governing Body of Thurston Primary School.
